title: Patient Name
instruction: Extract only the patient's full name. If no patient name is explicitly stated, use the default value. Do not invent a name.

title: Chief Complaint
instruction: State the patient's primary reason for visit concisely. Avoid direct quotes, additional context, or filler. End with a period.

title: History of Present Illness
content: Patient reports doing well overall but still experiences stickiness in the arm and decreased numbness and tingling. On examination, a mild scar at the incision site and mild pillar pain were noted, with no painful active extension. She reports discomfort when placing her hand on the ground. Activity is advanced, but bearing is tolerated. Home exercise program for pillar pain recommended. Follow-up in three months planned.
instruction: Summarize the patient's current illness. Include symptom onset, duration, severity, modifying factors, and prior treatments. Use precise medical terminology and complete sentences. Do not use direct speech, filler words, or first-person phrasing. Ensure medical terminology and grammar are correct. End each sentence with a period.

title: Past Medical History
instruction: List all relevant prior diagnoses, surgeries, and hospitalizations not related to the current complaint. Maintain a professional tone. Do not include current issues or treatment plans. End each sentence with a period.

title: Current Medications
instruction: List all current medications. Include name (generic/brand if known), dose, route, frequency, and duration. Format clearly. If none, use default. End each item with a period.

title: Family History
instruction: Mention relevant family medical conditions. Specify relationship and age at diagnosis if provided. If no family history is stated, return the default. End each sentence with a period.

title: Social History
instruction: Include occupation, living situation, and habits (e.g., smoking, alcohol, drug use, relevant sexual history). Use professional language. End each sentence with a period.

title: Allergies
instruction: List all mentioned medication, food, or environmental allergies. If none, return the default. End each item with a period.

title: HEENT
content: Eyes: No visual loss, blurred vision, double vision. Ears, Nose, Throat: No hearing loss, sneezing, congestion, runny nose or sore throat.
default: Eyes: No visual loss, blurred vision, double vision. Ears, Nose, Throat: No hearing loss, sneezing, congestion, runny nose or sore throat.
instruction: Summarize patient-reported symptoms for HEENT. If no relevant info, use the default. Do not fabricate details. End each sentence with a period.

title: Skin
instruction: Document specific physical exam findings related to skin. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: CARDIOVASCULAR
instruction: Summarize patient-reported cardiovascular symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Respiratory

title: Constitutional

title: MUSCULOSKELETAL

title: Lab Results
instruction: Summarize relevant laboratory results or indicate if none.

title: Assessment and Plan
content: Diagnosis: post-surgical pillar pain. Plan: home exercise program for pillar pain; activity advanced and bearing tolerated.
instruction: Provide the diagnosis and plan for the patient. The plan must be written with no medical abbreviations. The plan must also indicate the follow-up plan for the patient. The plan and assessment cannot exceed 2-3 lines.

title: Follow-Up
content: Patient to return in three months for follow-up.
instruction: If the patient has an upcoming appointment, describe the reason for the follow-up. If no follow-up is scheduled, note that there is none.
